Detailed Description

Tracks access either to a unicode string, or a file mapping to a unicode file.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

JSON::unibuffer::unibuffer (  )  [inline]

unibuffer::~unibuffer (  ) 

The destructor will try to unmap the buffer if it can.

Member Function Documentation

bool JSON::unibuffer::mapfile ( const wchar_t *  fn  ) 

bool JSON::unibuffer::mapfile ( const char *  fn  ) 

bool unibuffer::mapstring ( const wchar_t *  buf  ) 

sets up the buffer to read from the string buf. The buffer reads buf directly, so do not prematurely delete buf.

Parameters:
buf The unicode string to map. buf is not copied, for performance reasons. So if the string that buf points to is freed, then the unibuffer will be unreadable

bool unibuffer::mapchararray ( const wchar_t *  buf,
int  len 
)

maps a binary or un-zero-terminated string. See mapstring for more info

Parameters:
buf The unicode string to read
len The length of the unicode string, in characters.

bool unibuffer::unmap (  ) 

unmaps and forgets about buffer

Returns:
true, unless something unforseen has happened
